intro: Scholtzia uberiflora, commonly known as the woolly goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that provides insulation against the harsh coastal climate. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scholtzia uberiflora is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats along the coastline.
